snippet: What the beloved literary character seems to have in common with Strom Thurmond.
abstract: Op-Ed article by Prof Joseph Crespino contends Harper Lee novel Go Set a Watchman provides more sophisticated and subtle exploration of racial politics than her first-published book, To Kill a Mockingbird; holds character Atticus Finch's complexity and slow transition into reactionary, racist figure is reflected throughout Southern politics; says while Mockingbird offered easy answers, Watchman offers moral and political nuance.
lead_paragraph: What the beloved literary character seems to have in common with Strom Thurmond.

headline.main: Atticus Finch Offers a Lesson in Southern Politics
